snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said that the administration still favored a diplomatic solution, but that additional pressure on President Bashar al-Assad was needed.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says, on eve of meeting with Syrian opposition, that Obama administration still favors diplomatic solution in which Pres Bashar al-Assad would hand over power to transitional government; notes that additional pressure on Assad is needed; says administration is weighing increased efforts to support rebel fighters.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from London, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said that the administration still favored a diplomatic solution, but that additional pressure on President Bashar al-Assad was needed.

headline.seo: Kerry Says U.S. Is Weighing New Aid to Syria Rebels
headline.main: Before Meeting Syrian Opposition, Kerry Says U.S. Is Considering More Support
headline.print_headline: Before Meeting Syria Opposition, Kerry Says U.S. Is Considering More Support
